intro: Myristica rosselensis subsp. minutiflora, commonly known as the dwarf nutmeg. It is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the island of New Guinea. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and produces a reddish-brown seed that resembles the nutmeg of the more well-known Myristica fragrans. Its leaves are elliptical and革质, with a glossy surface. The subspecies is distinguished by its smaller flowers and fruits compared to the typical species.
